chapterTitle: Financial Leverage and Capital Structure Policy

columns.text: In this problem, we will construct the market value balance sheet of the firm prior to purchasing the land.

Substituting the values to the formula above, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Assets}&=8,000,000 \times \$37.80\\[15 pt]
&=\$302,400,000
\end{aligned}$$

The total assets of the firm prior to the purchase is valued at $\$302,400,000$

Now we can construct the market value balance sheet by plotting the value of the assets and the debt.

| Assets| \$302,400,000| 
|--|--| 
| Debt |-\$0 | 
|Market Value  |\$302,400,000 |

As we can see, since the firm is all-equity, then their market value is solely based on their equity or assets which is $\$302,400,000$
